snippet: The author of “Grand Pursuit” and “A Beautiful Mind” likes Victorian novelists for their deliciously wicked humor and the Russians for their political and philosophical musings.
abstract: By the Book interview with author Sylvia Nasar, who likes Victorian novelists for their humor and Russian writers for their political and philosophical musings.
lead_paragraph: The author of “Grand Pursuit” and “A Beautiful Mind” likes Victorian novelists for their deliciously wicked humor and the Russians for their political and philosophical musings.
